You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. It sounds like you have a great approach in mind. By preparing some guiding questions or topics, you'll be able to cover the important points you want to discuss, while also leaving room for flexibility and adaptability. This will allow you to have a productive and meaningful conversation with your sister.

Remember to stay calm, listen actively, and approach the conversation with an open mind. Try to understand your sister's perspective, and be willing to share your own thoughts and feelings. Don't be afraid to ask questions, clarify points, and seek common ground.

Most importantly, remember that the goal of the conversation is to improve your relationship and move forward in a positive way. By approaching the conversation with empathy, respect, and an open mind, you can create a stronger and more meaningful connection with your sister.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I wish you the best of luck with your conversation, and I hope it leads to a positive and productive outcome!
